title: World Energy and World Fuel Services extend partnership with a six-year, up to 27 million-gallon purchasing agreement - PR Newswire
summary: World Energy, a sustainable aviation fuel (SAF) producer, and World Fuel Services have signed a six-year agreement to deliver 27 million gallons of SAF, reducing air travel emissions by 200,000 metric tonnes. World Energy's SAF is produced in the United States using renewable feedstocks and is certified by the Roundtable on Sustainable Biomaterials (RSB).  The partnership between World Energy and World Fuel Services demonstrates the growing demand for SAF as the aviation industry works to decarbonize its operations. SAF can significantly reduce greenhouse gas emissions compared to traditional jet fuel, and it is expected to play a key role in the industry's efforts to achieve net-zero emissions by 2050.

title: We Have Set a Great Big Goal: Nothing. - Honda Newsroom
summary: Honda recently took three big steps within a single week in North America that illustrate their commitment to achieving their global goal of carbon neutrality – net zero emissions – for all products and corporate activities by 2050: They broke ground on a new joint venture EV battery plant in Ohio with LG Energy Solution; announced a basic agreement with U.S.-based Ascend Elements, Inc., to collaborate toward their goal of achieving a stable supply of recycled lithium-ion battery materials necessary for their future EVs in North America; and began demonstration operation of a stationary fuel cell power station at their headquarters in California that provides zero emission backup power. Their Triple Action to Zero approach involves using clean energy along with reusing and recycling all of the materials in a product they make, so they will no longer have to dig holes in the ground for finite materials and energy sources or bury spent materials in a hole in the ground at the end of their usable life.
